text: hey everybody i'm steven from langmaster
learning system bringing you another

speaking ability to see the first video
in this series click on the video link
today we're continuing with our series
on introductions with the question how
are you
sometimes when we study a new language
we end up sounding like robots it's
great for our confidence when we can
speak naturally and it helps us to make
a great first impression
how are you I'm fine thank you and you
this is fine for formal situations like
talking to your boss but usually this is
not how we speak especially to our
friends or in other casual situations
today we will learn different ways to
ask how are you and different ways we
can answer this question more naturally
so first let's learn some ways to ask
someone how they are you can say
how are you
how's it going
how have you been or to be very casual
what's up or just sup
when I asked my friends here in Vietnam
these questions I want to know how they
are so when someone asks you tell them
how you are doing or how you are feeling
here are some ways you can answer these
questions naturally you can say I'm
feeling great I'm pretty good
I'm okay or if you're not feeling great
you can tell your friends say something
like I'm alright but I'm a bit tired I
didn't get a lot of sleep
I'm great but I'm so hungry
I'm not feeling very well I drank too
much last night
after you answer them you can say what
about you how about yourself or and you
it's much more fun to speak a new
language if you can speak naturally
try some of these new phrases next time
a friend asks you how you are and try
talking like a human not like a robot I
am fine thank you and you
I hope you found this video useful if
you did be sure to like and share it
with your friends who sound like robots
